titleStmt.title: S.W. Hall v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: S.W. Hall v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District, Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia for the Counties of Thurston, Mason, Lewis and Chehalis.
In the matter of the application of Henry Palm for a writ of Habeas Corpus } Petition for Writ
To the Honorable Roger S. Greene, Judge of said Court.

The petition of Henry Palm respectfully shows, that he the said Henry Palm is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined, and restrained of his liberty by William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County; at the County jail in Thurston County Washington Territory:
That said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this towit -

That on or about the 13th day of April 1878 your petitioner was arrested in the town of Olympia in said County and Territory, upon a warrant sworn out by one I.V. Morsman, charging him with the crime of murder, committed in the town of Olympia in the year 1874. That on the 19th and 20th days of April 1878 a preliminary hearing was had before one A.R. Elder, a committing magistrate in and for said town of Olympia and for said County, and at the close of said hearing your petitioner was committed by said Elder to answer the said charge, before the next Grand Jury in and for said County.

Your petitioner that nothing in the evidence adduced before such magistrate justified such commitment. Nothing having been shown tending to criminate your petitioner in the slightest degree. That your petitioner is an innocent man, and is not guilty of the crime charged. That the next Grand Jury will not meet until December next, some eight months from this time, and that your petitioner will, unless your Honor grant his petition, be wrongfully incarcerated for that length of time to his
